repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - First, Second, Third,
            Fourth, Fifth, Sixth Poverty Reduction Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First, Second, and Third
            Poverty Reduction Credit Project (PRSC) for Burkina Faso are
            as follows: outcomes of the project were satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and the performance of the Bank
            and the Borrower was also rated satisfactory. Ratings for
            the Fourth, Fifth, and Sixth Poverty Reduction Credit
            Project for Burkina Faso are as follows: outcomes of the
            project were satisfactory, sustainability is moderate, and
            the performance of the Bank and the Borrower was also rated
            satisfactory. The lessons learned from the report are: 1)
            PRSCs are useful instruments to help the borrower assume
            increased responsibility in managing its public resources in
            an efficient manner, notably by providing more flexibility
            and predictability; however, there is a risk of complacency
            and of dependence on continued foreign budget support; 2)
            issues of attribution are inevitable when the reform
            programs are supported by several donors; 3) since outcomes
            are to be assessed after several years, the quality of the
            relevant statistical data is critical; if insufficient,
            preparation should include remedial actions, including the
            selection and definition of baseline data; 4) since reforms
            are of medium-to long-term nature, early identification of
            institutional weaknesses and capacity constraints is of
            paramount importance; and 5) to assess outcome of a
            medium-term program, it is essential that the different
            documents of a PRSC series be consistent in content and
            format, including statistical series and other data.

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Third Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings suggest a satisfactory
            project outcome, likely sustainability, substantial
            institutional development impacts, and satisfactory
            performances by the Bank and Borrower. Lessons highlight
            that the Poverty Reduction Support Credit (PRSC) series
            greatly reinforced the importance of the budget, and the
            country's own capacity for the success of government
            policies, steadily strengthening the focus on the budget as
            the main instrument for PRSP implementation. PRSCs also
            successfully supported a number of cross-cutting reforms.
            These reforms included the application of de-concentration
            policies in budget and personnel management, which are part
            of the policies to improve social service delivery. In the
            cotton sector, the opening of two zones for private
            investors, involved the establishment of the new regulatory
            framework, and the definition of roles of the new and old
            stakeholders. However, despite achievements, a number of
            challenges remain for the PRSCs. Burkina Faso faces
            difficulties in attracting private investment as a result of
            low skill levels, and high costs of production factors. The
            growth agenda of the PRSP should therefore be an additional
            important area for support under future PRSCs, as well as
            for the Country Assistance Strategy. Other lessons outline
            improving the PRSC-related sectoral dialogue; aligning
            budget support with the budget cycle; reinforcing
            capacities; improving the link between policy actions and
            the monitoring and evaluation framework; and, improving
            inter-ministerial coordination.

5610450.trustfund:
TF033969-AFRICA REGION - ROCK, PHOSPHATE,TF050516-PHRD-BURKINA FASO: POVERTY
            REDUCTION SUPPORT CREDIT III (PRSC)

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Poverty Reduction Support
            Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Operation (PRSC-3) is the third in a series of operations
            for Burkina Faso to support the implementation of the 2000
            Poverty reduction strategy paper (PRSP) in line with the
            Bank's strategy presented in the 2000 Country
            assistance strategy (CAS). Consistent with the four
            strategic pillars of the PRSP this project supports the
            implementation of key reforms to improve the management of
            public resources, strengthen basic service delivery in the
            social sectors, and raise rural incomes.  The project has
            been selected for grant financing because of its poverty
            focus and the close monitoring of outcomes under the PRSP
            process.  PRSC-3 maintains public sector reform and sectoral
            policies for the poor as its two main components.  It
            supports a series of measures that build closely on the
            achievements under previous PRSCs and moves increasingly to
            more output-related actions. The progress made by the
            government in implementing its poverty reduction strategy
            and the related reform program fully justify moving to
            PRSC-3 as all but one of the triggers were met fully or in
            large part.

2368303.trustfund:
TF033969-AFRICA REGION - ROCK, PHOSPHATE,TF050516-PHRD-BURKINA FASO: POVERTY
            REDUCTION SUPPORT CREDIT III (PRSC)

repnme.cdata!:
Burnika Faso - Third Poverty Reduction
            Support Operation Project (03) : Environmental Assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Poverty Reduction Support
            Operation (PRSC-3) for Burkina Faso provides an analysis of
            the potential environmental and social impacts. The
            government's objective is to maintain a sound
            macroeconomic environment, and accelerate growth by
            providing external resources for the execution of the
            government's 2003 budget. There will be anticipated
            impacts, and mitigating measures. The potential
            environmental and social impacts are those resulting from
            its sectoral coverage. The potential environmental and
            social impacts can only be descried in generic terms. The
            rural development operations envisaged fall under two
            categories. The first category concerns the development of
            actions susceptible to encourage agricultural
            diversification. The second category of activities includes
            those associated with the liberalization of the cotton
            sub-sector. Diversification may improve soil fertility
            management and reduce the need for insecticide use. The
            activities supported under the basic health sector
            development evolve around strategic policy reforms aimed at
            more effective targeting of the poor for the delivery of
            basic services, institutional strengthening and
            decentralization of service provision, and human resource
            strengthening. The potential environmental aspects
            associated with the intensification of agricultural
            production will promote conservation practices that will
            help maintain the productive capacity of the resource base.
            Control of pesticide related pollution, and hazards. The
            government will support the promotion of alternative and
            complementary ways of pest management.

Burnika Faso - Third Poverty Reduction
            Support Operation Project (03) : Environmental Assessment
